nodes.title: Mission Ethos
nodes.excerpt: The warp vessel is a vow to return radiance to the Sun, pairing physics with compassion.
nodes.bodyMD:
The craft is not built for conquest; it exists to tend the stellar ledger and keep worlds nourished.

We treat each joule extracted from the vacuum as a promise to replenish what was lost elsewhere.

When measurements disagree with our story, we revise the story. The vow survives by truth, not by force.
nodes.summary: The warp vessel is a vow to return radiance to the Sun, pairing physics with compassion.

nodes.title: Interbeing Systems
nodes.excerpt: Dependent systems make promises real; every public commitment is a dependency graph.
nodes.bodyMD:
Dependent arising is operations realism: nothing stands alone. Fuel depends on ports, hospitals depend on power, contracts depend on courts, and courts depend on legitimacy.

A promise that ignores its dependencies is a false promise. We require cross-sector coherence before we accept a plan as viable.

Anti-pattern: silo virtue, where each ministry is right and the system still collapses.

Minimal artifact: Interbeing Map, a published dependency model with if-this-fails/that-fails links and second-order impacts.

See [[node:bodhisattva-craft]], [[node:stewardship-ledger]], and [[node:feedback-loop-hygiene]].
nodes.summary: Dependent systems make promises real; every public commitment is a dependency graph.

nodes.title: Sangha Architecture
nodes.excerpt: Community is a container for practice; durable civic design makes consent possible.
nodes.bodyMD:
Sangha is not an abstract vibe. It is a structured community that holds practice, truth-telling, and repair.

In society, integration requires durable civic containers where consent can form, grievances can surface safely, and legitimacy is generated through participation rather than performance.

Anti-pattern: order without consent, where streets are quiet and resentment grows loud.

Minimal artifact: Civic Sangha Charter, rules for inclusive local councils, protected civic space, and conflict-mediation norms.

See [[node:values-over-images]], [[node:voice-integrity]], and [[node:worldview-integrity]].
nodes.summary: Community is a container for practice; durable civic design makes consent possible.

nodes.title: Citizen's Arc
nodes.excerpt: A dignity-floor civilization that runs voluntary trials to select stewards and keeps power revisable.
nodes.bodyMD:
The citizen's arc is the societal ladder: soft ground, hard tests, clear mirrors.

The floor ends coercive scarcity, the ladder reveals competence, and the roof keeps tradeoffs explicit. This view is the civic mirror that keeps Mission Ethos honest.

Addenda: [[node:citizens-arc-anti-mutation]] and [[node:citizens-arc-stress-test]].

See [[node:interbeing-systems]], [[node:scarcity-justice]], [[node:capability-ambition-gradient]], [[node:struggle-testament]], [[node:promise-trials]], [[node:koan-governance]], [[node:values-over-images]], [[node:worldview-integrity]], [[node:sangha-architecture]], [[node:no-bypass-guardrail]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:inner-spark]], [[node:lifetime-trust-ledger]], [[node:solitude-to-signal]], and [[node:habit-pressure-break]].
nodes.summary: A dignity-floor civilization that runs voluntary trials to select stewards and keeps power revisable.

nodes.title: Citizen's Arc: Anti-Mutation Addendum
nodes.excerpt: Anti-mutation mechanisms keep selection systems from hardening into status systems.
nodes.bodyMD:
Selection mutates into status unless the system is built to resist it. The citizen's arc must carry explicit anti-mutation mechanisms that reduce prestige capture and keep exit rights real.

Mechanisms:
- Sortition oversight for trials, audits, and ledger disputes.
- Rotating authority with hard term limits and cooling-off gaps.
- Power decomposition: many small powers, few big ones; no single chokepoint.
- Strong exit rights: portable credentials, safe dissent channels, and mobility support.
- Cultural immunology: teach distrust of prestige narratives; reward refusal to glamorize pain.

Anti-pattern: credential aristocracy or ritualized suffering.

Minimal artifact: Anti-Mutation Charter, listing rotation schedules, sortition pools, exit guarantees, and prestige-shaping norms.

See [[node:capture-resistance]], [[node:impermanence-by-design]], [[node:no-bypass-guardrail]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:data-dignity]], and [[node:habit-pressure-break]].
nodes.summary: Anti-mutation mechanisms keep selection systems from hardening into status systems.

nodes.title: Citizen's Arc: Stress Test Note
nodes.excerpt: Attack packets map predictable failure modes into checks the civic system must pass.
nodes.bodyMD:
Stress tests are how the citizen's arc proves it can scale without mutating.

Attack packets:
- Charismatic Trial-Optimiser: cross-checks, ledger decay, and red-team interviews before authority is granted.
- Caregiver Exodus: caregiving credit, alternate trials, and representation floors so care labor is not punished.
- Audit Coup: audit authority split, rotation, and public appeal path to prevent compliance capture.
- Border Koan: scarcity allocation charter plus a tradeoff ledger that names who bears the cost.
- Crisis Velocity Failure: emergency procedures with sunset clauses and review triggers.

Anti-pattern: performing the test without changing the ladder.

Minimal artifact: Citizen's Arc Stress-Test Register with triggers, metrics, and reversal thresholds.

See [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:scarcity-justice]], [[node:koan-governance]], [[node:impermanence-by-design]], [[node:capture-resistance]], and [[node:verification-checklist]].
nodes.summary: Attack packets map predictable failure modes into checks the civic system must pass.

nodes.title: Right Speech Infrastructure
nodes.excerpt: Speech is ethical action; trustworthy channels keep society coherent.
nodes.bodyMD:
Right speech is truth, non-harm, and timeliness expressed in systems. Society integrates through trustworthy channels: reporting, verification, public updates, and rumor-to-fact pipelines that do not default to censorship or propaganda.

Informing is protective. Withholding material information is not neutral; it lets fear author the story. We prefer clear disclosure, stated uncertainty, visible corrections, and public indicators over rumor competition.

Anti-pattern: information predation, where manipulation, extortion, or false certainty dominates the channel.

Minimal artifact: Trusted Channel Protocol, with multi-channel intake, anonymity options, independent follow-up SLAs, and public stats on closure rates.

See [[node:voice-integrity]], [[node:compromised-channel-response]], and [[node:verification-checklist]].
nodes.summary: Speech is ethical action; trustworthy channels keep society coherent.

nodes.title: Restorative Harm Repair
nodes.excerpt: Compassion with accountability: repair reduces harm and reintegrates society.
nodes.bodyMD:
Compassion without accountability becomes impunity; accountability without repair becomes vengeance. We reduce suffering through repair and enforce credible consequences for abuse.

Anti-pattern: cycles of revenge or impunity with paperwork.

Minimal artifact: Harm Repair Ladder, a staged pathway for investigation, protection, restitution options, escalation triggers, and public reporting that preserves dignity.

See [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:stewardship-ledger]], and [[node:verification-checklist]].
nodes.summary: Compassion with accountability: repair reduces harm and reintegrates society.

nodes.title: Impermanence by Design
nodes.excerpt: Build institutions to adapt without breaking legitimacy; emergency power must expire.
nodes.bodyMD:
Impermanence is reality, so governance must adapt without breaking trust. We design for change: sunset clauses, review cycles, reversible pilots, and clear amendment paths.

This keeps contracts and mandates durable across political shifts because procedure stays continuous even when leadership changes.

Anti-pattern: brittle governance and forever transitions that turn emergency power into permanent power.

Minimal artifact: Sunset + Review Register, where every exceptional power has an expiry and audit requirement.

See [[node:provenance-protocol]], [[node:lifetime-trust-ledger]], and [[node:promise-trials]].
nodes.summary: Build institutions to adapt without breaking legitimacy; emergency power must expire.

nodes.title: Koan Governance
nodes.excerpt: Hold real paradoxes without collapsing into slogans; accountable tradeoffs are explicit.
nodes.bodyMD:
Koans train the mind to hold paradox without collapse. Governance faces real tradeoffs: security vs liberty, speed vs due process, unity vs pluralism. We name the tensions and decide with accountability instead of pretending they do not exist.

Anti-pattern: ideological rigidity and whiplash policy.

Minimal artifact: Tradeoff Ledger, recording values at stake, risks, mitigations, reversal triggers, and metrics for every major decision.

See [[node:beginners-mind]], [[node:values-over-images]], and [[node:promise-trials]].
nodes.summary: Hold real paradoxes without collapsing into slogans; accountable tradeoffs are explicit.

nodes.title: Three Tenets Loop
nodes.excerpt: Not-knowing, bearing witness, taking action: a governance cycle that learns in public.
nodes.bodyMD:
The three tenets loop is a social action cycle: Not-Knowing, Bearing Witness, Taking Action. We encode it as governance discipline.

Not-Knowing: suspend certainty, avoid propaganda certainty, and name assumptions.

Bearing Witness: gather ground truth, listen to impacted communities, and publish indicators.

Taking Action: act, then measure, then correct.

Anti-pattern: action first, reality later.

See [[node:beginners-mind]], [[node:verification-checklist]], [[node:bodhisattva-craft]], [[node:feedback-loop-hygiene]], and [[node:civic-signal-loop]].
nodes.summary: Not-knowing, bearing witness, taking action: a governance cycle that learns in public.

nodes.title: Civic Signal Loop
nodes.excerpt: Survey-based civic sensing turns community signals into lawful, accountable action.
nodes.bodyMD:
Civic signals are how a society listens without panic. We apply the three tenets loop to surveys, listening sessions, and public indicators.

Not-Knowing: acknowledge uncertainty, publish sources, and keep room for "not sure" responses.

Bearing Witness: gather grounded input with data dignity, safe channels, and consent-first framing.

Taking Action: translate signals into lawful, nonviolent policy moves with review triggers.

Anti-pattern: rumor-driven escalation, vigilantism, or data extraction without consent.

Minimal artifact: Civic Signal Survey + Response Matrix (question categories -> node mapping -> action playbook).

See [[node:three-tenets-loop]], [[node:right-speech-infrastructure]], [[node:data-dignity]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:sangha-architecture]], [[node:skillful-mediation]], [[node:civic-memory-continuity]], and [[node:no-bypass-guardrail]].
nodes.summary: Survey-based civic sensing turns community signals into lawful, accountable action.

nodes.title: No Bypass Guardrail
nodes.excerpt: Equanimity is not neutrality toward harm; calm language must not delay protection.
nodes.bodyMD:
Zen language can become a dodge. This guardrail prevents calm speech from anesthetizing harm or delaying accountability.

Equanimity is not neutrality toward predation. When credible harm signals appear, the protect and investigate path must start.

Silence in the face of credible harm signals is an action. Withholding information is not neutral; fear fills the gap. Default to timely disclosure with uncertainty markers and correction logs, and document any temporary limits.

Anti-pattern: spiritual bypass, process theater, or staying above it while harm continues.

Minimal artifact: Bypass Checklist. If a credible harm signal appears, start protection and investigation. Silence or delay requires recorded justification and independent review.

See [[node:values-over-images]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:restorative-harm-repair]], [[node:voice-integrity]], and [[node:three-tenets-loop]].
nodes.summary: Equanimity is not neutrality toward harm; calm language must not delay protection.

nodes.title: Capture Resistance
nodes.excerpt: Design so capture is hard; predation is a systems bug, not a personnel issue.
nodes.bodyMD:
Institutional capture is a systems phenomenon, especially at chokepoints like permits, fuel, ports, procurement, and enforcement. We design for resistance: separation of duties, auditability, recusal norms, and transparency requirements.

Anti-pattern: reform theater, elite recycling, or new faces with the same extraction.

Minimal artifact: Capture Risk Register, a public list of high-leverage chokepoints and the protections that exist.

See [[node:stewardship-ledger]], [[node:provenance-protocol]], [[node:interbeing-systems]], [[node:feedback-loop-hygiene]], and [[node:verification-checklist]].
nodes.summary: Design so capture is hard; predation is a systems bug, not a personnel issue.

nodes.title: Scarcity Justice
nodes.excerpt: Fairness under scarcity is a legitimacy engine when restoration is uneven.
nodes.bodyMD:
Scarcity forces rationing. Legitimacy depends on clear allocation criteria, transparent prioritization, and an appeals path when everything cannot be restored at once.

Anti-pattern: queue-jumping, resource apartheid, or rationing-by-relationship.

Minimal artifact: Scarcity Allocation Charter, with criteria, prioritization logic, appeals, and a publication cadence.

See [[node:bodhisattva-craft]], [[node:stewardship-ledger]], [[node:values-over-images]], [[node:koan-governance]], and [[node:verification-checklist]].
nodes.summary: Fairness under scarcity is a legitimacy engine when restoration is uneven.

nodes.title: Data Dignity
nodes.excerpt: Measurement must not become coercion; data collection stays minimal and accountable.
nodes.bodyMD:
Reporting and verification create data exhaust. We protect people from metric-powered coercion through data minimization, retention limits, consentful use, and redress.

Anti-pattern: surveillance creep, doxxing-by-process, or we measure you therefore we own you.

Minimal artifact: Civic Data Covenant, stating what data is collected, why, who can access it, how long it is kept, how misuse is appealed, and how audits occur.

See [[node:right-speech-infrastructure]], [[node:voice-integrity]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:verification-checklist]], and [[node:compromised-channel-response]].
nodes.summary: Measurement must not become coercion; data collection stays minimal and accountable.

nodes.title: Civic Memory Continuity
nodes.excerpt: Legitimacy survives when decision rationale survives turnover.
nodes.bodyMD:
Societies need continuity of rationale: why a decision was made, what evidence and tradeoffs were used, and what correction triggers exist. This prevents policy from resetting to rumor after each political shift.

Anti-pattern: institutional amnesia or policy by rumor.

Minimal artifact: Decision Rationale Archive, a public record of major commitments with assumptions, evidence, signatories, tradeoffs, review dates, and reversal triggers.

See [[node:provenance-protocol]], [[node:liveness-or-it-didnt-happen]], [[node:impermanence-by-design]], and [[node:koan-governance]].
nodes.summary: Legitimacy survives when decision rationale survives turnover.

nodes.title: Skillful Mediation
nodes.excerpt: Nonviolent dispute handling is a designed civic capability, not an afterthought.
nodes.bodyMD:
Daily conflicts over land, labor, utilities, and governance require a civic metabolism. Mediation must be legible and safe so disputes do not default to escalation.

Anti-pattern: every dispute becomes existential.

Minimal artifact: Mediation Ladder, an escalation path from dialogue to facilitated mediation to adjudication or repair, with protections for vulnerable participants.

See [[node:sangha-architecture]], [[node:right-speech-infrastructure]], [[node:restorative-harm-repair]], and [[node:koan-governance]].
nodes.summary: Nonviolent dispute handling is a designed civic capability, not an afterthought.

nodes.title: External Interface Integrity
nodes.excerpt: Partner without capture; external ties must stay transparent and bounded.
nodes.bodyMD:
External actors can stabilize or distort everything. We handle donors, NGOs, foreign governments, sanctions systems, and external capital without becoming a proxy battlefield or extraction opportunity.

Anti-pattern: aid capture, dependency loops, opaque side-deals, or proxy governance.

Minimal artifact: External Partnership Register, listing purpose, commitments, reporting expectations, conflict-of-interest handling, and termination or sunset terms.

See [[node:worldview-integrity]], [[node:values-over-images]], and [[node:reciprocity-contract]].
nodes.summary: Partner without capture; external ties must stay transparent and bounded.

nodes.title: Verification-Based Diplomacy
nodes.excerpt: When trust is low, peace depends on verification, not handshakes.
nodes.bodyMD:
Trust is low. When trust is low, diplomacy cannot rely on handshakes and rhetoric. It must evolve from trust-based diplomacy to verification-based diplomacy.

An integrity floor is the shared minimum: the question is not who is right but how to prevent trade, money, and logistics from leaking into shadow rails that prolong harm. Zen governance refuses to pretend the rails are neutral.

Anti-pattern: peace by press release while supply rails continue to feed harm.

Minimal artifact: Verification Diplomacy Charter with shared claims, verification steps, audit trails, and rollback triggers.

See [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:verification-checklist]], [[node:interbeing-systems]], [[node:external-interface-integrity]], and [[node:right-speech-infrastructure]].
nodes.summary: When trust is low, peace depends on verification, not handshakes.

nodes.title: Shadow Rail Interdiction
nodes.excerpt: Pressure targets the shadow stack that keeps harm funded and supplied.
nodes.bodyMD:
Wars are sustained by systems: fuel moving, money clearing, parts arriving, and intermediaries profiting. Pressure should target the shadow stack: opaque shipping, fake insurance, illicit procurement networks, and predatory intermediaries.

Keep defensive and civilian-survival support predictable so civilians are protected and not used as leverage.

Anti-pattern: broad embargoes that starve civilians while gray networks thrive.

Minimal artifact: Shadow Rail Map + Interdiction Plan with beneficial-ownership disclosure, shipping and insurance audits, and verified civilian carve-outs.

See [[node:interbeing-systems]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:external-interface-integrity]], [[node:capture-resistance]], and [[node:harm-weighted-priority-standard]].
nodes.summary: Pressure targets the shadow stack that keeps harm funded and supplied.

nodes.title: Dignified Exit Design
nodes.excerpt: Off-ramps reduce cornered escalation without rewarding aggression.
nodes.bodyMD:
When a heavily armed state believes there is no dignified exit, pride, fear, and sunk-cost logic can trap actors in escalation loops. A dignified exit is not a reward; it is an off-ramp so peace does not require humiliation as fuel.

Non-attachment (Zen) rejects victory narratives that demand continued harm. Non-forcing (Daoist) avoids cornering an armed state into pride-driven escalation.

Anti-pattern: maximalist demands with no face-saving path.

Minimal artifact: Off-Ramp Package with phased verification, face-saving language, time-bounded security assurances, and review triggers.

See [[node:koan-governance]], [[node:restorative-harm-repair]], [[node:impermanence-by-design]], [[node:skillful-mediation]], and [[node:no-bypass-guardrail]].
nodes.summary: Off-ramps reduce cornered escalation without rewarding aggression.

nodes.title: Repair Debt Compact
nodes.excerpt: Harm creates a repair debt that must be restored, audited, and time-bounded.
nodes.bodyMD:
Legitimacy is not determined by stockpiles. In the moral grammar of order, harm creates a repair debt: an obligation to restore what was broken and reduce future suffering.

Repair is not revenge, and it is not humiliation. Commitments must be auditable, escrowed, revocable, and time-bounded so reconstruction does not become a new corruption surface or permanent control.

Anti-pattern: reconstruction as slush funds, patronage, or indefinite occupation.

Minimal artifact: Repair Escrow Covenant with audit hooks, release triggers, and sunset clauses.

See [[node:restorative-harm-repair]], [[node:stewardship-ledger]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:jurisdictional-floor]], and [[node:metric-integrity-guardrail]].
nodes.summary: Harm creates a repair debt that must be restored, audited, and time-bounded.

nodes.title: Capability & the Ambition Gradient
nodes.excerpt: Abundance shifts what challenge means; warp capability expands the horizon, so we must choose worthy problems on purpose.
nodes.bodyMD:
When basic needs are met, the environment stops training us through scarcity. Without intentional practice, attention drifts and ambition decays into comfort loops.

The warp program is a deliberate replacement: not manufactured hardship, but voluntarily hard, measurable problems - curvature budgets, duty discipline, and falsifiable claims.

Capability is expressed in hull geometry (Lx_m, Ly_m, Lz_m) and warp geometry kind/warpFieldType, so ideology must constrain how we choose to use that reach.

Warp capability is an amplifier. It can widen compassion or widen coercion. So we bind it to the Stewardship Ledger: keep zeta <= 1, keep TS >= 1, compare kappa_drive vs kappa_body, and label provenance + liveness.

If/when a bubble can be manufactured, the goal is not conquest or escape from gravity - it is escape from narrow incentives: new objectives that reduce coercion, broaden agency, and replenish what we take.

See [[node:stewardship-ledger]], [[node:struggle-testament]], and [[node:integrity-protocols]].
nodes.summary: Abundance shifts what challenge means; warp capability expands the horizon, so we must choose worthy problems on purpose.

nodes.title: Bodhisattva Craft
nodes.excerpt: Logistics of compassion: move fuel from distant novae back to Sol to keep balance.
nodes.bodyMD:
Transport is our meditation. Every convoy is a mudra aligning engineering, attention, and relief.

Ledger discipline matters: duty, TS, and curvature budgets  each metric is a moral accounting entry.
nodes.summary: Logistics of compassion: move fuel from distant novae back to Sol to keep balance.

nodes.title: Stewardship Ledger
nodes.excerpt: Duty stays green; TS stays high; compare kappa_drive vs kappa_body to prove average safety.
nodes.bodyMD:
Hold zeta  1 to keep curvature from cracking the hull or the vow.

Light-crossing cadence (TS  1) is how relativity hears the average promise rather than the spikes.
nodes.summary: Duty stays green; TS stays high; compare kappa_drive vs kappa_body to prove average safety.

nodes.title: Beginner's Mind
nodes.excerpt: Shoshin resists stagnation; we tune geometry so the vacuum keeps breathing cleanly.
nodes.bodyMD:
Gamma_geo  20 with a_eff near 0.984 nm: not just math, but a breathing space for attention.

Port polishing, Q preservation, and healthy duty cycles are the same as protecting wonder.
nodes.summary: Shoshin resists stagnation; we tune geometry so the vacuum keeps breathing cleanly.

nodes.title: Inner Spark
nodes.excerpt: Preserve wonder so real partnership  between humans or with spacetime  is possible.
nodes.bodyMD:
A child's drive to stay whole mirrors our need to keep the warp bubble coherent.

Presence is an engineering control loop: if you cannot stabilize your own signal, you cannot stabilize spacetime.
nodes.summary: Preserve wonder so real partnership  between humans or with spacetime  is possible.

nodes.title: Dream Integrity
nodes.excerpt: Protect aspirations from insecurity or oppression; the vow is not indulgence.
nodes.bodyMD:
Dreams are not luxuries; they are bearings. We protect them because they keep the craft aligned with the vow.

When insecurity or pressure demands you shrink, name the demand and refuse the trade. Safety bought by abandoning purpose is false safety.

Practice:
- Keep the aspiration visible.
- Name what cannot be traded away.
- Take the next step that keeps the vow intact and verify it.
nodes.summary: Protect aspirations from insecurity or oppression; the vow is not indulgence.

nodes.title: Struggle as Testament
nodes.excerpt: Sweat, tears, and humor are artifacts; they prove we earn each coordinate.
nodes.bodyMD:
Every challenge logged in the ledger is a calibration point for compassion.

When dreams are questioned, understanding bridges the distance better than thrust does.
nodes.summary: Sweat, tears, and humor are artifacts; they prove we earn each coordinate.

nodes.title: Devotion as Course Plotting
nodes.excerpt: Navigation is devotional math: the course is set by what we choose to protect.
nodes.bodyMD:
Project the pledge onto the stars  keep them shining and wonder unbroken.

Zen and spacetime meet when physics is wielded as compassion instead of conquest.
nodes.summary: Navigation is devotional math: the course is set by what we choose to protect.

nodes.title: Worldview Integrity
nodes.excerpt: When evidence breaks the story, let the story break  not the people.
nodes.bodyMD:
Self-deception is a private apocalypse: the world remains, but the map is gone.

We refuse to protect a worldview by sacrificing compassion or by manipulating others. If a model requires coercion to survive, it is already failing.

Our method is simple: make claims that can be tested, keep the ledger, and revise without shame.

See [[node:stewardship-ledger]] for the operational guardrails and [[node:beginners-mind]] for the discipline of clean attention.
nodes.summary: When evidence breaks the story, let the story break  not the people.

nodes.title: Values Over Images
nodes.excerpt: Enduring values anchor the vow while images adapt to the moment.
nodes.bodyMD:
Well-defined ideology lasts because it conserves what stays true across cycles: compassion, truth, and the constraints we refuse to trade away. Images, status, and short-term gains shift fast, so they cannot be the root.

Self-first here means self-aligned: a steady center that lets the outer image adapt without collapse. When the anchor is internal, you can change presentation without losing the vow.

In the systems loop, constraints are the values; outputs are the images; verification is the self-check that keeps the core intact.

The swan is our emblem of this balance: grace without drift, selectivity without cruelty.

See [[node:worldview-integrity]] and [[node:integrity-protocols]].
nodes.summary: Enduring values anchor the vow while images adapt to the moment.

nodes.title: Integrity Protocols
nodes.excerpt: Break false loops with provenance, liveness, cross-checks, ledger, compassion, and revision so innovation stays constructive.
nodes.bodyMD:
In high-stakes systems, the easiest mistake is self-serving certainty. This protocol exists to prevent that: separate what is decidable (claims that can be measured, cross-checked, costed, and revised) from what is chosen (values we refuse to trade away).

Six codes:
- **Provenance:** every claim names source, time, method, and scope.
- **Liveness:** track age; label stale explicitly.
- **Cross-checks:** no single-channel certainty; require an independent read and a falsification hook.
- **Ledger:** costs are accounted, not hidden; name who bears them (risk, burden, exclusion, downstream harm).
- **Compassion:** the chosen constraint; protect the vulnerable and reduce coercion, even when it costs status or convenience.
- **Revision:** update without shame; when measures disagree or channels feel compromised, downgrade confidence, rollback, and re-verify.

Innovation is not novelty; it is a promise that survives contact with reality.

Feedback loops inherit stories. Some are true, many are stale, and some are weaponized. Our job is to keep only what can be carried forward without distortion.

See [[node:stewardship-ledger]] for guardrails and [[node:beginners-mind]] for signal discipline.
nodes.summary: Break false loops with provenance, liveness, cross-checks, ledger, compassion, and revision so innovation stays constructive.

nodes.title: Provenance Protocol
nodes.excerpt: Trust is voice + provenance: every claim carries its source.
nodes.bodyMD:
We do not accept anonymous certainty.

When you state a metric, prediction, or value, attach:
- **Source** (where it came from)
- **Time** (when it was observed)
- **Method** (how it was produced)
- **Scope** (what it does *not* cover)

If any of those are missing, label the claim **unknown** until verified.

Next: [[node:liveness-or-it-didnt-happen]].
nodes.summary: Trust is voice + provenance: every claim carries its source.

nodes.title: Liveness or It Didnt Happen
nodes.excerpt: No cached myths: prove liveness or mark stale.
nodes.bodyMD:
A value that cannot be shown to update is not evidence.

Stability is good (noise dies out). Staleness is dangerous (myths look stable). So we always track **age** and label **stale** explicitly.

This is how we break generational feedback loops: we do not pass forward unlabeled snapshots.

Next: [[node:voice-integrity]].
nodes.summary: No cached myths: prove liveness or mark stale.

nodes.title: Voice Integrity
nodes.excerpt: Assume the channel can be hijacked: cross-check before you believe.
nodes.bodyMD:
Companionship is not proof. Agreement is not proof. A single channel is not proof.

When outcomes matter, we require at least two independent reads and a delta check. If the reads diverge, we downgrade confidence and switch to a safer posture.

See [[node:compromised-channel-response]].
nodes.summary: Assume the channel can be hijacked: cross-check before you believe.

nodes.title: Feedback Loop Hygiene
nodes.excerpt: Close loops only with verified signals.
nodes.bodyMD:
Feedback loops amplify what they measure. If the measurement is corrupted, the loop becomes a lie generator.

We keep loops constructive by:
- Choosing the right window (instant vs averaged).
- Using guardrails (duty, zeta, TS) to bound harm.
- Keeping a rollback path when signals go weird.

Innovation lives here: new ideas become safe when they enter a loop with proof and guardrails.

See [[node:reciprocity-contract]].
nodes.summary: Close loops only with verified signals.

nodes.title: Habit Pressure Break
nodes.excerpt: Refuse inherited dependency loops; choose self-alignment when tradition demands conformity.
nodes.bodyMD:
Habit pressure is legacy gravity. It asks for repetition because it is old, not because it is true.

We break it by pausing, naming the pressure, and checking what it asks us to trade away. If the loop demands dependence, we label it stale and step out of it.

Practice the break in steps:
- Pause and name the inherited habit.
- Check provenance: who set it, when, and for what purpose.
- Test liveness: is it still serving the present.
- Choose alignment: keep what protects the vow, drop what narrows it.
- Re-enter with a new loop and a verification hook.

See [[node:values-over-images]] and [[node:liveness-or-it-didnt-happen]].
nodes.summary: Refuse inherited dependency loops; choose self-alignment when tradition demands conformity.

nodes.title: Verification Checklist
nodes.excerpt: Narratives must ship with verification hooks.
nodes.bodyMD:
A manifesto is only useful if it can be tested.

Every claim we publish should include:
- What to measure
- Where to read it
- What would falsify it
- What to do next if falsified

This makes the story portable without becoming propaganda.
nodes.summary: Narratives must ship with verification hooks.

nodes.title: Compromised Channel Response
nodes.excerpt: If the truth-anchor sounds wrong, re-verify and downgrade.
nodes.bodyMD:
If a signal feels urgent but cannot be verified, treat urgency as a threat model.

Response pattern:
1. **Slow down** (reduce duty / choose SAFE posture).
2. **Cross-check** (independent channel, derived vs computed).
3. **Label stale** (do not let a bad feed become a story).
4. **Rebuild trust** (run diagnostics, re-establish provenance).

We keep the promise by refusing to steer on corrupted data.
nodes.summary: If the truth-anchor sounds wrong, re-verify and downgrade.

nodes.title: Reciprocity Contract
nodes.excerpt: Timing honesty: if burst < LC, the average claim is not earned.
nodes.bodyMD:
Reciprocity is timing honesty.

- If **burst  LC**, we can treat the cycle-average as meaningful.
- If **burst < LC**, we are sampling faster than the light-crossing time and the average claim is not earned.

This is not moralizing about speed. It is a guardrail against self-deception.

See [[node:stewardship-ledger]] and [[node:liveness-or-it-didnt-happen]].
nodes.summary: Timing honesty: if burst < LC, the average claim is not earned.

nodes.title: Phoenix Averaging
nodes.excerpt: Step back: choose the right window to see the real signal.
nodes.bodyMD:
Solitude in a system is a windowed average.

Instant readings are useful, but easy to manipulate and easy to misread. The cure is to step back to the correct window: instant, LC, burst, or one-sector.

Innovation stays constructive when the window matches the claim.

See [[node:beginners-mind]] and [[node:stewardship-ledger]].
nodes.summary: Step back: choose the right window to see the real signal.

nodes.title: Solitude to Signal
nodes.excerpt: Isolation as a deliberate window that clarifies self-guidance and seeds new inspiration.
nodes.bodyMD:
Solitude is not retreat; it is signal processing. The distance lowers noise so guidance can be heard without distortion.

We use isolation to choose a window that fits the claim: long enough to settle, short enough to stay honest.

Practice:
- Step out of the loop and name the noise.
- Hold the window until the signal stabilizes.
- Write the next move and re-enter with a testable aim.
nodes.summary: Isolation as a deliberate window that clarifies self-guidance and seeds new inspiration.

nodes.title: Promise Trials
nodes.excerpt: Promises are proven under separation and pressure.
nodes.bodyMD:
When a mission splits roles, the vow is tested.

One side continues the work. Another side becomes exposed to stress, persuasion, or noise. We measure integrity by what happens next:
- Do we return with proof, or with a story?
- Do we protect the vulnerable, or use them as evidence?

Innovation depends on this. Without trustworthy promises, teams cannot take coherent risks.
nodes.summary: Promises are proven under separation and pressure.

nodes.title: Lifetime Trust Ledger
nodes.excerpt: Trust is time-tested evidence, not momentary agreement.
nodes.bodyMD:
Trust is an archive, not a feeling. We build it by keeping promises over time and showing work that survives pressure.

Agreement can be easy; evidence is earned. A single moment can inspire, but it cannot certify.

Practice:
- Record what was promised and what was delivered.
- Mark the time span and the conditions.
- Prefer patterns that repeat under stress.
nodes.summary: Trust is time-tested evidence, not momentary agreement.

nodes.title: Jurisdictional Floor
nodes.excerpt: Law is the minimum rights and procedure floor; ethos adds completeness.
nodes.bodyMD:
Binding law is a floor, not a vibe. The ethos tree does not replace it; it adds a completeness layer for non-harm, non-domination, non-attachment, right speech, right livelihood, interbeing, sangha, repair, and integrity loops.

We model this as versioned ruleset packs per jurisdiction and a crosswalk that maps each norm to ethos nodes.

Anti-pattern: claiming ethical intent to bypass binding rules, or using legal compliance as a shield for predation.

Minimal artifact: Ruleset Pack + Norm-Ethos Crosswalk with versioned notes and invalidators.

See [[node:two-key-approval]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], and [[node:external-interface-integrity]].
nodes.summary: Law is the minimum rights and procedure floor; ethos adds completeness.

nodes.title: Two-Key Approval
nodes.excerpt: Plans are approved only when both legal and ethos gates pass.
nodes.bodyMD:
Two keys must turn before the system mints approval: a legal key and an ethos key.

Legal key: the artifact complies with the selected jurisdiction ruleset. Ethos key: even if legal, it remains non-harm, non-domination, non-attachment, consent-based, reversible, and verifiable, with right speech and right livelihood intact.

Anti-pattern: shipping artifacts that are legal-but-predatory or ethical-but-unlawful.

Minimal artifact: Dual-Key Gate Sheet attached to every plan, contract, public communication, and payout request with pass/fail evidence and invalidators.

See [[node:jurisdictional-floor]], [[node:verification-checklist]], and [[node:no-bypass-guardrail]].
nodes.summary: Plans are approved only when both legal and ethos gates pass.

nodes.title: Lawful Interface Protocol
nodes.excerpt: Bridge civic institutions and enforcement with lawful boundaries, non-harm, and accountability.
nodes.bodyMD:
This protocol defines how civic institutions interface with enforcement agencies without predation or interference. It focuses on lawful rights education, oversight design, and nonviolent response.

Practice:
- Publish cooperation boundaries and correction logs.
- Require dual-key approval (legal + ethos) for joint actions.
- Provide safe reporting channels with non-retaliation safeguards.
- Enforce de-escalation, independent review, and repair pathways when force is used.
- Maintain liaison councils and mediation pathways.
- Audit incentives and publish outcomes to prevent capture.

Minimal artifact: Lawful Interface Protocol.

See [[node:jurisdictional-floor]], [[node:two-key-approval]], [[node:right-speech-infrastructure]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:restorative-harm-repair]], [[node:skillful-mediation]], [[node:capture-resistance]], [[node:civic-memory-continuity]], and [[node:external-interface-integrity]].
nodes.summary: Bridge civic institutions and enforcement with lawful boundaries, non-harm, and accountability.

nodes.title: Federal Civic Listening Circuit
nodes.excerpt: Scheduled listening cycles keep federal policy grounded in local reality.
nodes.bodyMD:
Federal policy loses legitimacy when listening is ad hoc. This circuit sets a fixed calendar for field hearings and hybrid sessions, with a Local Needs Docket submitted in advance and a Response Ledger published afterward.

Anti-pattern: listening without response or only broadcasting from the top.

Minimal artifact: Local Needs Docket + Response Ledger, with cadence and rationale archive.

See [[node:right-speech-infrastructure]], [[node:civic-memory-continuity]], [[node:sangha-architecture]], [[node:interbeing-systems]], and [[node:external-interface-integrity]].
nodes.summary: Scheduled listening cycles keep federal policy grounded in local reality.

nodes.title: Metric Integrity Guardrail
nodes.excerpt: Replace quota logic with harm-reduction indicators and review triggers.
nodes.bodyMD:
Metrics must reflect harm reduction and legitimacy, not throughput. This guardrail bans quota logic and requires public definitions, invalidators, and review triggers for every headline metric.

Anti-pattern: treating counts as proof of justice.

Minimal artifact: Metric Policy Register with definitions, invalidators, and review cadence.

See [[node:koan-governance]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:capture-resistance]], [[node:verification-checklist]], and [[node:values-over-images]].
nodes.summary: Replace quota logic with harm-reduction indicators and review triggers.

nodes.title: Harm-Weighted Priority Standard
nodes.excerpt: Priority decisions anchored to credible harm and due process.
nodes.bodyMD:
Prioritization must be anchored to credible harm and due process, not convenience. This standard documents priority tiers, evidence thresholds, and independent review.

Anti-pattern: easy targets become the priority.

Minimal artifact: Harm-Weighted Priority Standard + Review Log.

See [[node:no-bypass-guardrail]], [[node:restorative-harm-repair]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:data-dignity]], and [[node:jurisdictional-floor]].
nodes.summary: Priority decisions anchored to credible harm and due process.

nodes.title: Integration Ladder
nodes.excerpt: A lawful on-ramp for long-term integrated residents.
nodes.bodyMD:
Long-term integrated residents need a lawful on-ramp that reduces fear and stabilizes communities. The ladder defines criteria, timelines, data limits, and audit hooks.

Anti-pattern: permanent limbo that invites exploitation.

Minimal artifact: Integration Ladder Charter.

See [[node:restorative-harm-repair]], [[node:interbeing-systems]], [[node:jurisdictional-floor]], [[node:data-dignity]], [[node:civic-memory-continuity]], and [[node:scarcity-justice]].
nodes.summary: A lawful on-ramp for long-term integrated residents.

nodes.title: Local Stability Compact
nodes.excerpt: Protect community stability during enforcement shifts.
nodes.bodyMD:
Local economies are fragile. The compact requires stability impact statements and mitigation plans when enforcement shifts would disrupt staffing, services, or supply chains.

Anti-pattern: ignoring second-order effects.

Minimal artifact: Local Stability Compact + Stability Impact Statement.

See [[node:interbeing-systems]], [[node:scarcity-justice]], [[node:sangha-architecture]], [[node:civic-memory-continuity]], and [[node:external-interface-integrity]].
nodes.summary: Protect community stability during enforcement shifts.

nodes.title: Access-to-Counsel Pathway
nodes.excerpt: Rights with access: counsel, language support, and clear timelines.
nodes.bodyMD:
Rights without access are ceremonial. This pathway guarantees referrals, language access, and timelines with data dignity safeguards.

Anti-pattern: rights on paper that people cannot use.

Minimal artifact: Access-to-Counsel Pathway.

See [[node:right-speech-infrastructure]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:data-dignity]], [[node:restorative-harm-repair]], and [[node:skillful-mediation]].
nodes.summary: Rights with access: counsel, language support, and clear timelines.

nodes.title: Training and Certification Gate
nodes.excerpt: Doctrine stays alive through training, renewal, and review.
nodes.bodyMD:
Doctrine dies without practice. This gate requires training, renewal, and incident-linked review for safety-critical roles.

Anti-pattern: stale certification or box-check training.

Minimal artifact: Certification Register with renewal cadence and incident review hooks.

See [[node:bodhisattva-craft]], [[node:integrity-protocols]], [[node:verification-checklist]], [[node:civic-memory-continuity]], and [[node:no-bypass-guardrail]].
nodes.summary: Doctrine stays alive through training, renewal, and review.
